CatDescriptText: Related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 3, 1959, pg. A8, reads: "Newlyweds at Home Following Dec. 26 Nuptials. After a week in New York City, Mrs. and Mrs. Robert L. Williams will be at home on Adelaide St.  The happy couple was married Dec. 26 in rites performed at the Green Hearthe [sic] by the Rev. James A. Cox.  The bride is the daughter of the late Martha and Allen Kendrick.  She chose a pink Chantilly lace and chiffon sheathe over satin, with a small sequin hat.  She carried a small testament with orchids and lily of the valley streamers.  Mrs. Hidyet Collington, matron of honor, wore blue taffeta with matching accessories.  The groom, the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Williams, had Charles Gaines as his best man.  Among the out-of-town guests were Dr. and Mrs. Randolph of Aliquippa; John Williams of Rochester, N. Y., and Miss Doris Perkins of Philadelphia."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of five men, including groom Robert L. Williams, and three women, including bride Dorothy Kendrick Williams wearing pink Chantilly lace and chiffon sheathe over satin dress and sequinned hat with short veil, posed behind three tiered wedding cake, in Greene Hearth, another version
